office:text.text:p: Node – any place where document is processing - usually in different departments or by employees in the department who perform various stages of document processing.
Document type – is the description of documents processing order of a particular type (i.e., their routes between nodes, and the average and maximum expected time of processing inside them).
Average expected time of processing – is used to evaluate the anticipated completion processing time of a document.

A maximum expected time of processing – is used to monitor the processing delay of a document. After the delay, the System sends messages about it to addresses indicated when registering a particular type of document.
office:text.text:h: A brief description of the task used as the Preferred Embodiment
office:text.text:p: An organization must organize multi-document tracking.
The project developer knows all the conditions of document management in the organization.
Each document is registered before processing. The registration includes:

text:list-item.text:p: who initiates the processing of the document (the "client")
any e-mail addresses which the System can use for automatically sending alerts if necessary (for example, the delay in processing a document if it exceeds the established limits in the organization)
to what document type the document belongs
the internal code of the document (automatically)

office:text.text:p: The organization develops procedures for processing documents (including routes between nodes with an option to return the document into the previous node if necessary) before processing. No document can be processed if it is not possible at registration to determine the type to which it belongs.
Delivery time intervals are defined in the descriptions of the document routes.
The System automatically stores the history of the document’s processing.
The information on the status of documents in the System can be requested in any combination: by documents, by nodes, or by clients.
The organization can use four types of databases: My SQL, Microsoft SQL, PostgreSQL, and ORACLE. The project should be easily transferred between them.
The organization does not have programmers, testers, and database administrators, who can be involved in the development, debugging, and support of the project.
The project should be available for multilingual users.
The organization intends to use the project for commercial purposes (sell, lease, provide services to other organizations for multi-document tracking their documents).
Preferred Embodiment should demonstrate the main distinguishing features of ProTIS from other systems, as shown in sections Uniqueness, Usefulness, Feasibility, and Enablement of this application.
office:text.text:h: Requirements to the project used for Preferred Embodiment.
office:text.text:p: In addition to the previous requirements, it should be demonstrated that in the project

text:list-item.text:p: the number of clients (owners of documents) is not limited
the number of documents, belonging to clients, is not limited
the number of nodes is not limited
the number of document types is not limited
the history of the movement of documents must be formed automatically.

office:text.text:h: Set of operations of the Preferred Embodiment
office:text.text:p: Operations in the PE have described herein the order they are recommended for a better understanding concept of the System. After working with PE using operations can be performed in order the user wants.
